title: Online and distance selling for businesses

details.description: Rules online and distance selling businesses must follow
details.body:
If you’re selling goods online or by any other distance method, you must provide certain information for your customers.

Online and distance selling includes any business that supplies goods through:

  • the internet and email
  • digital TV
  • phone, text messages or fax
  • mail order

Before an order is placed

You must display information such as:

  • your business name (and address if you want payment in advance)
  • a description of your goods or services
  • the price, including all taxes
  • how a customer can pay
  • delivery arrangements, costs and how long goods will take to arrive
  • the minimum length of their contract
  • conditions for terminating contracts of over 1 year or open-ended contracts
  • information about the customer’s right to cancel

It’s also good practice to explain who pays for returning goods if the customer cancels.

After an order is placed

In good time after an order is placed, and no later than the delivery of the goods, you must provide your customer in writing with:

  • how and when they can cancel an order and who pays for returning goods
  • an address where complaints can be sent
  • any guarantees or after-sales services you offer
  • conditions for terminating contracts of over 1 year or open-ended contracts

Online sellers

If you sell goods online, you must also do certain things such as:

  • list the steps involved in a customer placing an order
  • acknowledge receipt of any orders electronically as soon as possible
  • make it easy for customers to check their orders and correct any errors, and explain how to do so
  • let customers know what languages are available to them
  • make sure customers can store and reproduce your terms and conditions, ie these can be downloaded and printed off
  • give your email address and VAT number (if your business is registered for VAT)

You can find more information on the rules for online and distance selling on the Office of Fair Trading’s distance selling hub.

Online sellers must also follow the ‘Electronic Commerce Regulations’.

Download ‘Guidance notes for the electronic commerce regulations’ (256KB)

Sale of Goods Act

All businesses that supply goods, including online and distance sellers, must follow the ‘Sale of Goods Act’.

Download ‘The Sale of Goods Act explained’ (1.7MB)
